Lewis | pseudonym = | birth_date = | birth_place = | death_date = | death_place = Eugene, Oregon | occupation = storyteller, short story writer, actor | nationality = American | period = | genre = | subject = Fiction | website = }} Mark Lewis (February 16, 1954 â€“ December 7, 2014) was an American storyteller, actor, and teacher. He was known for being the narrator in the Pirates of the Caribbean rides on Disneyland. Lewis died in Eugene, Oregon from surgical complications, aged 60. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1954 births Category:2014 deaths Category:Deaths from surgical complications Category:American movie actors Category:Educators from Oregon Category:Actors from Oregon Category:Writers from Oregon Category:American Emmy Award winners
